article:
In charitable organizations, a 'drive' is a collection of items for people who
need them, such as clothing, used items, books, canned food, cars, etc. Some
drives are that people go through their inventory, bag the items up, and put
them in a giveaway bin, or charitable organizations such as Big Brothers Big
Sisters, The Salvation Army come to the house and pick them up. They then put
the items in their thrift stores or, if they don't have any, sell them to thrift
stores to raise money for their organization.
